author: The Current
description:
Watch Leif Vollebekk play a solo MicroShow in Minneapolis for The Current
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Canadian singer-songwriter Leif Vollebekk swung through Steady Pour in northeast Minneapolis for a special performance on Friday, Jan. 17, 2025. He released his fifth studio album, Revelation, in 2024.

This event was the latest in The Current’s MicroShow series, supported by @voodoorangerIPA.

Songs Performed
00:00:00 Moondog
00:05:50 Peace of Mind (Morning)
00:09:33 False-Hearted Lover
00:13:41 Rock and Roll
00:17:34 Southern Star
All songs from Leif Vollebekk’s 2024 album, Revelation, available on @secretcityrecords.

Musician
Leif Vollebekk – vocals, guitar, keyboards

Credits
Guest – @leifvollebekk 
Producer – Derrick Stevens
Video – Eric Xu Romani, Evan Clark
Audio – Derek Ramirez
Graphics – Natalia Toledo
Digital Producer – Luke Taylor

Subscribe to our channel:
http://www.youtube.com/user/893TheCurrent?sub_confirmation=1  

Li
title: Leif Vollebekk plays a MicroShow at Steady Pour in Minneapolis

author: The Current
description:
Watch Bad Bad Hats play a full set at First Avenue in Minneapolis
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

Twin Cities-based indie rock band Bad Bad Hats — featuring an extra guitarist due to lead singer Kerry Alexander nursing an injured arm — performed on night two of The Current's 20th Anniversary Celebration, held Saturday, Jan. 25, 2025, at First Avenue in Minneapolis. Watch Bad Bad Hats' full set, recorded live.
 
Songs performed
00:00:00 Gloria Love 
00:02:59 Nothing Gets Me High 
00:08:28 Let Me In 
00:11:47 Walkman 
00:16:23 My Heart Your Heart
00:19:11 Talk With Your Hands 
00:22:52 Meter Run 
00:25:53 Milky Way 
00:28:34 TPA
00:31:55 band introductions
00:32:41 Midway 
00:35:56 Detroit Basketball 
00:39:33 Supersize (Megasound)

Musicians
Kerry Alexander – vocals
Colby Hansen – bass
Joey Carl Hays – drums, backing vocals
Chris Hoge – guitar, backing vocals
Seth Duin – guitar
Elana Carroll – guest vocalist on Megasound song

Credits
Vide
title: Bad Bad Hats perform at The Current's 20th Anniversary Celebration at First Avenue (FULL SET)

author: The Current
description:
Minneapolis-based shoegaze band she's green play a set at First Avenue
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube or hit the Thanks button

The past couple years have seen a fascinating rise for she's green. They kicked off 2024 by playing First Avenue's Best New Bands of 2023 showcase. Then in April, they received the most votes and support in The Current's very first Minnesota Music Month Scouting Report. And on January 24, 2025, she's green performed at The Current's 20th Anniversary Celebration held at First Avenue in Minneapolis. Watch the full set above.

Songs performed
00:00:00 [Unreleased]
00:05:20 Graze
00:10:01 [Unreleased]
00:12:25 Purple
00:16:37 Mandy 
00:20:38 Smile Again

Musicians
Zofia Smith – vocals
Liam Armstrong – guitar
Raines Lucas – guitar
Teddy Nordvold – bass
Kevin Seebeck – drums

Credits
Video – Erik Stromstad, Evan Clark
Audio – Eric Xu Romani

Subscribe to our channel:
http://www.youtube.com/user/893TheCurrent?sub_confirmation=1

author: The Current
description:
To celebrate The Current’s 20th Anniversary, The Current’s Live Sessions Vault unlocks never-before-seen live performance videos of bands and artists who have played in our iconic studio. 

Watch to see the full session of jeremy messersmith, featuring previously unreleased footage, from when he visited The Current studio back in 2018.

Songs Performed 
00:00:00 Purple Hearts
00:03:29 Happy
00:07:22 Monday, You’re Not So Bad
00:10:30 Fast Times In Minnesota

Musicians
jeremy messersmith — vocals, guitar
Cameron Kinghorn — trumpet
Ian Allison — bass
Brian Tighe — guitar
Andy Thompson — piano

Credits
Engineer – Michael DeMark
Producer – Andrea Swensson, Jesse Wiza
Visuals  – Nate Ryan
Digital Producer – Natalia Toledo
Graphics – Natalia Toledo

The Current’s Live Sessions Vault is supported by the Minnesota Orchestra, GS Motors, and Delta Dental of Minnesota Foundation.

http://www.youtube.com/user/893TheCurrent?sub_confirmation=1
